title: TotalSeq™-A Antibodies and Cell Hashing with 10x Single Cell 3' Reagent Kit v3 3.1 Protocol
title_html: TotalSeq™-A Antibodies and Cell Hashing with 10x Single Cell 3' Reagent Kit v3 3.1 Protocol

protocol.title: TotalSeq™-A Antibodies and Cell Hashing with 10x Single Cell 3' Reagent Kit v3 3.1 Protocol
protocol.title_html: TotalSeq™-A Antibodies and Cell Hashing with 10x Single Cell 3' Reagent Kit v3 3.1 Protocol

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description:
• Prepare single cell suspension following a suitable protocol.
  • Resuspend cells at a concentration of 2x107cells/mL in staining buffer.
  • Make note of cell viability (>95%) and also include dead cells in the total cell count.
  • If high cell death is observed, live cell enrichment (e.g. by Flow Cytometry) is recommended.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Aliquot 50 µl of cells into 12 x 75mm tubes.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description:
Add 5 µl of Human TruStain FcX™ Fc, or 0.5 µl of TruStain FcX™ PLUS (anti-mouse CD16/32) Blocking reagent.  
Note: We no longer recommend the use of dextran during blocking/staining. If you have any questions please contact BioLegend 
Technical Support
.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Incubate for 10 min at 4°C.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: While cells are incubating in Fc Block, prepare antibody pool using 1 µg (or titrated amounts) of each TotalSeq™ or Biotinylated antibody.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: To maximize performance, centrifuge the antibody pool at 14,000xg at 2 – 8°C for 10 minutes before adding to the cells. Note: If antibody cocktail volume is less than 50 µl, add Cell Staining Buffer up to 50 µl, then centrifuge.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Carefully pipette out the liquid, avoiding the bottom of the tube, and add the TotalSeq™ antibody cocktail to the cell suspension.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Incubate for 30 minutes at 4°C.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Add 2 mL of cell staining buffer and spin 5 minutes 350g at 4°C. Repeat wash 2 more times for a total of 3 washes.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description:
If using biotinylated antibodies, incubate with the appropriate oligo
barcoded
 streptavidin at the recommended amount specified in the product technical datasheet for 20 minutes.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Add 2 mL of cell staining buffer and spin 5 minutes 350g at 4°C. Repeat wash 2 more times for a total of 3 washes.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Resuspend cells in 500 µL of PBS to get a concentration of 1x106 cells/mL.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Filter cells through 40 µm Flowmi™ Cell Strainer.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Verify cell concentration by counting on hemocytometer after filtration.

source.title: I) Cell labeling

source.description: Dilute cells as necessary for appropriate input into the 10X Chromium controller.

source.title: II) Run 10x Genomics single cell 3' v3 assay

source.description:
Run 10x Genomics single cell 3' v3 assay as described through Post Gem-RT Cleanup – Dynabeads (step 2.1). 10x Genomics Document CG000185,
Rev B
.
At cDNA amplification step (Step 2.2), use the following table:  
ABCD
1ADT 1 rxn (µl)HTO 1rxn (µl)ADT + HTO 1 rxn (µl)
2Amp Mix505050
3cDNA Primers*151515
4ADT Additive Primer (0.2 µM stock)101
5HTO Additive primer (0.2 uM stock)011
6Total666667
Notes:
Follow steps 2.3A and 2.3B exactly to separate ADTs/HTOs from cDNA. Continue to use 70 µL of sparQ or SPRI beads in step 2.3B. ADT: Antibody derived tags, it refers to regular TotalSeq™-A antibodies HTO: TotalSeq™-A Hashtag antibodies See notes at the end of the protocol for further details on primer sequences.

ABCD
1ADT 1 rxn (µl)HTO 1rxn (µl)ADT + HTO 1 rxn (µl)
2Amp Mix505050
3cDNA Primers*151515
4ADT Additive Primer (0.2 µM stock)101
5HTO Additive primer (0.2 uM stock)011
6Total666667

source.description:
Incubate in a thermal cycler with the following protocol:

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Post ADT/HTO library amplification clean-up

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Add 120 µl sparQ or SPRIselect Reagent (1.2X) to each sample.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Incubate 5 min at room temperature.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Place on the magnet in its High position until the solution clears.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Carefully remove and discard the supernatant.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Place tubes on magnet in its High position. Wash pellet twice with 200 µl 80% ethanol.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Centrifuge briefly. Place on the magnet Low. Remove remaining ethanol.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Remove from the magnet. Add 40.5 µl water.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Incubate 2 min at room temperature.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Place on the magnet in its Low position until the solution clears.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description: Transfer 40 µl to a new tube strip. Store at 4°C for up to 72 h or at −20°C for long-term storage.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description:
ADT/HTO libraries are now ready to be sequenced.
Quantify libraries by standard methods (QuBit, BioAnalyzer, qPCR).     
ADT libraries will be around 180 bp (Figure 1).
Note: Step 4 from the 10x Genomics user guide document number CG000185, Rev B only applies to the cDNA library and NOT to the TotalSeq™-A library.

source.title: III) ADT and mRNA library preparation

source.description:
Sequencing CITE-seq libraries:
We estimate that an average of 100 molecules per ADT per cell is sufficient to achieve useful information. The number of reads required to obtain 100 molecules depends on the complexity of the sequencing library (e.g. duplication rate). ADT and mRNA cDNA sequencing libraries can be pooled at desired proportions. To obtain sufficient read coverage for both libraries, we typically sequence ADT libraries in 5-10% of a lane and cDNA library fraction at 90% of a lane (HiSeq2500 Rapid Run Mode Flowcell) (Approximately 5k reads/cell for ADTs).
Please visit our
website
for more important notes and troubleshooting regarding this protocol.

materials.name: Human TruStain FcX™ (Fc Receptor Blocking Solution)

description:
Buyer is solely responsible for determining whether Buyer has all intellectual property rights that are necessary for Buyer's intended uses of the BioLegend TotalSeq™ products. For example, for any technology platform Buyer uses with TotalSeq™, it is Buyer's sole responsibility to determine whether it has all necessary third party intellectual property rights to use that platform and TotalSeq™ with that platform.  TotalSeq™-B antibodies are designed to be used with 10x Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kit v3 with Feature Barcoding. The adjusted protocol below is for customers who are utilizing TotalSeq™-A antibodies with the v3 kit instead. Note: Step 4 from the 10x Genomics user guide document number CG000185, Rev B only applies to the cDNA library and NOT to the TotalSeq™-A library.  Please read the entire protocol below and the 10x Genomics user guide for the Chromium Single Cell 3ʹ Reagent Kits v3 with Feature Barcoding technology for Cell Surface Protein before starting the experiments. 10x Genomics user guide document number CG000185, Rev B. Commonly used abbreviations:
  • ADT: Antibody derived tags, the oligo sequence conjugated to regular TotalSeq™-A antibodies
  • HTO: Hashtag oligonucleotides, the oligo sequence conjugated to TotalSeq™-A Hashtag antibodies
